body:
Hello Mostapha,



I ve been using Ladybug to run some Radiation Analysis,

For some dates, (not all of them), there seems to be some issue with the legend not showing up when I set the Analysis period to be same day from morning till night.

Only the lowest value of the legend appears.



The analysis seems to be running fine, judging from the gradient of the colors.



In this particular example the legend appears for Dec 22nd from 06.00-22.00 but not for other dates like Dec 21 same time period. Sky appears also to be just one color whenever the problem occurs.



I attach the files for your reference.

Thanks a lot,

Dimitris
topic: Ladybug Radiation Analysis Legend not appearing

replies.body:
Hi Chris,



Thank you very much for the response!

I assumed it had to do something with the setting in the range of the values but wasn't sure what.

I ll use fixed min/max values for the time being.



Thanks again!

Dimitris
Added to github: ([https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/77](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/77)). Thank you both.

Glad to be of help!

Thank you!



Dimitris

Hi Chris

Is there a way to project the felt tempreture on a plane rather than on the person? Or relate the Radiation Analysis to a temprature graph?
Hi Amy, I think it is possible but Chris can give you the final answer about this. I would open a new discussion for this. -Mostapha
Thank you. I will open a new one

Hi Amy,

You should make a new discussion here in the LB_HB group, or if you want I can make, cause I'm interested in this topic also.

regards

Peter
